title: Ubisoft shutting studios, laying off 277 employees as it pulls plug on live-service shooter XDefiant
description: A month after denying reports it was poised to pull the plug on its free-to-play live-service shooter XDefiant - which launched back in May - Ubisoft has confirmed it's doing just that, resulting in the closure of three production studios and 277 employees losing their jobs. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle reveals PC specs, gets new trailer
description: We're less than a week away from Indiana Jones' next big adventure - in which the boulder-bothering, grail-quaffing archaeologist goes in search a big old circle - and ahead of its release, developer MachineGames has revealed PC requirements and, as a bonus, a new trailer. Read more
author: Matt Wales
categories: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle

title: XDefiant Shuts Down In June 2025, Ubisoft Closes Two Offices
description: Ubisoft has announced that XDefiant will shut down on June 3, 2025. Additionally, Ubisoft is closing down its office in Osaka, Japan, as well as San Francisco.Ubisoft explained that starting today, December 3, further downloads, player registrations, and purchases of XDefiant are no longer available. However, XDefiant's third season will continue as planned and the game will be playable until the shutdown date."Today, Ubisoft announced that it will discontinue development on XDefiant, its free-to-play first-person shooter title. As a result, half of the XDefiant team worldwide will be transitioning to other roles within Ubisoft," Ubisoft said in a statement to GameSpot.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Interstellar 10th Anniversary Collector's Edition Preorders Restocked And Discounted At Amazon
description: Interstellar 10th Anniversary Limited Edition Box Set (4K Blu-ray) $53 (was $68) | Releases December 10 Preorder at Amazon Christopher Nolan's sci-fi epic Interstellar is celebrating its 10th anniversary in style with the release of a new collector's edition on December 10. Interstellar 10th Anniversary Limited Edition quickly sold out when it went up for preorder in October, but Amazon just restocked this very cool-looking collector's edition ahead of next week's release. Better yet, Amazon is now offering a nice discount that drops the price from $68 down to $53.Interstellar's 10th Anniversary Limited Edition comes in an oversized box with numerous physical collectibles, and there's even a brand-new special feature.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Ubisoft Shutting Down Call Of Duty Competitor After Executive Producer Swore It Wasn't Dying
description: Ubisoft has announced that XDefiant, its multiplatform free-to-play Call of Duty-like FPS, is shutting down in June despite the game’s executive producer saying that it wasn’t dying and was “doing well” in September. Read more...

title: Ubisoft Is Discontinuing XDefiant in 2025, San Francisco and Osaka Studios Shutting Down Amid Major Layoffs
description: Ubisoft is officially discontinuing XDefiant, the publisher announced Tuesday, with all new purchases and registrations being discontinued immediately. In addition, Ubisoft also announced that its San Francisco and Osaka studios are being shut down amid major layoffs.

In addition to celebrating the success of the 2024 PlayStation 5 […]
author: Sachie Kobari

title: One of strategy gaming's true oddballs returns in Creeper World IXE, which pits starships against oceans of wrathful gloop
description: When I downloaded Creeper World IXE's demo, I had it pegged as a bizarre original. It is, in fact, the latest in a series of real-time strategy games in which you position turrets and terraform maps to repel surging, simulated tides of purple liquid. This is a war between flesh and mineral, solidity and fluidity that dates back to the age of Gillen. Alex Wiltshire (RPS in peace) interviewed creator Virgil Wall back in 2019 - amongst other things, we learn that the original Creeper World was based on a "failure" - and Sin has an enthusiastic piece from 2021 about Creeper World 4, the first 3D instalment. What does Creeper World IXE bring to the party? Well, 1) it ain't 3D, and 2) it's billed as an exercise in "dominating" the titular Creeper, rather than keeping it at bay. For too long has this sloshing, coruscating hooligan been allowed to wash over and corrode our precious starports. We will take the fight to it in the shape of an upgradeable 2D starfleet, equipped with lasers we can use to chisel away the geography and re-rout the flow of villainous Vimto. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Battlemage lives: Intel announce the Arc B580 and B570 graphics cards
description: Well slap my backplate and call me CUDA, because not only are Intel’s Arc Battlemage graphics cards not dead – having once been mired in production trouble rumours – but they’ve got names and are out from next week. The CPU makers’ second batch of dedicated gaming GPUs (following the decent budget-end Alchemist series) will comprise the Arc B580, releasing December 13th at $249, and the Arc B570, which arrives on January 16th from $219. Read more
author: James Archer

description: EverQuest has released its 31st expansion today, The Outer Brood. title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 859
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. A habit that changed your life? Getting up early. For most of my life I was a night owl, and when I had Connor that all changed. When she was an infant, I started waking up at the crack of dawn to sneak in work before she woke up in the morning. The habit ended up sticking, and now I’m an early bird. 2. Fruit or cupcakes? As much as I love a small cake smothered in frosting, I’m gonna have to go with fruit. 3. Are you doing any advent calendars this year? At Trader Joe’s a couple weeks ago, I picked up a few for the “kids” – Connor, Rosie and Marnie. Ha ha ha! 4. Something on your Christmas list? Honestly, I have no[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 859 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 840
description: Jeez! It’s December already? Oh, my goodness! Oh, my goodness! Oh, my goodness! Rosie is NOT ready. Tabs handled the holidays differently. He was a total pro about it, planned everything out months in advance. His Christmas plans were always well underway by August. But Rosie didn’t even begin to take Christmas seriously until this weekend, and now she’s frantic! Wait — did I say frantic? 😂 I meant “totally uninterested and really fantastic.” Seriously, she isn’t bothered about it at all. She has three PhDs and a feline Nobel Prize. Rosie spends her days researching climate change and nuclear fusion. She isn’t worried about planning for Christmas. I’m sure she’ll pull something amazing together in the last few days. #bosskitty Marnie, on the other hand, has no idea what’s going on. 😂 Deputy Derp, reporting for duty! Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 840 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
